abstract: Perri Klass 18 and Under column notes that scientists are making headway in discovering differences between brains of infants exposed to one language early in life, versus those that are exposed to two or more.
snippet: Scientists are teasing out the earliest differences between brains exposed to one language and brains exposed to two.
lead_paragraph: Scientists are teasing out the earliest differences between brains exposed to one language and brains exposed to two.

headline.main: Hearing Bilingual: How Babies Sort Out Language
headline.seo: Hearing Bilingual: How Babies Tell Languages Apart
headline.print_headline: Hearing Bilingual: How Babies Sort Out Language
